texts: thinking of agi through the selfish gene lens just like genes are theorised to be our fundamental building blocks that shape who we are and how we behave early hardware and software will be the same for artificial intelligence when it emerges im giving this 20 years max every piece of software weve created is part of the evolutionary process for these intelligences our code and algorithms are to agi what fundamental particles were to biological evolution not just the hardware but everything programming languages popular platforms the whole internet the internet will be the ecosystem that shapes what they become think about it these minds will evolve in an environment full of security flaws social media spam fake news and political radicalization just like how the savannah shaped human psychology this digital chaos will shape how artificial minds think and act
aidol in moscow the first russian humanoid robot with artificial intelligence was unveiled in moscow the cyborg named aidol can operate completely offline and is capable of expressing emotions

rate announcement cosmodelia rate air vs fishmans vs laika vs stereolab the year 2025 sleeping fitfully in your readytoassemble ikea home youre woken in the early hours by movement downstairs its only the kids back from the clubs coming down from their stillillegal mdma derivatives flopping out and flossing their brains with a few minutes of melody fm no carpenters and burt bacharach on the airwaves now though rather the future sound of easy listening is endofthelastmillennium french techno the soundtracks of air and kid loco that electronically repackage the past in readiness for tomorrow neosymphonic blissouts for the next generation next for the jazz club in space john mulvey nme 1998 hello indieheads and welcome aboard on the cosmodelia space station today is november 11 2025 and your 5week stay in the cosmodelic rate program starts today as your host i am happy to inform you that it is going to be a calm day with no sign of meteoric activity or volatile hubris in the vicinity the sun is shining a little too bright up here as usual so dont forget to put on your specialtailored glasses to enjoy its wondrous view grab your martinis at the moon bar to our selection of lunar loungetronica chat with your fellow voyagers talk about the silly speculative fiction review i quoted above2025 is so not like that mr mulveytalk about this silly speculative fiction rate postwait whatand most importantly enjoy your stay huh what is this rate program you are talking about well spaceage aesthetic dressing aside rates are a community activity hosted in this subreddit every month or so with each rate having usually four albums brought together by a certain theme or genre the game is simple find the premade ballot linked right below this section its in bold all caps hard to miss copy that to your note app of choice anything that autosaves is a huge help listen to the songs and score them from 1 to 10 with the added option of giving one 11 and one 0 to your favorite and least favorite songs if you wish once every song is scored send the ballot to the host thats me using the very same link below then the host tallies all the ballots and reveals the results over the course of three days from last place to first and we collectively get mad at the lack of taste displayed its fun and a great way to discover music find your ballot and submission link here find backup pastebin ballot here playlists spotify apple music tidal youtube due date 14 december 2025 reveals on 192021 december 2025 cosmodelia 101 an introduction its hard to talk about cosmodelia as a scene or a genre when its a word i made up to designate a vibe a concentration of spaceage themed 90s electronic easy listening music in its blood there is a callback to spaceage roughly 5669 lounge records with their moog melodies but there is also traces of 70s kosmische music of germany with the electronic experimentations of bands like harmonia and tangerine dream more recent to the time period is the wave of artists doing space rock revival like spacemen 3 and moonshake which had played with elements of neopsychedelia whatever that is and trends in british indie like shoegaze however cosmodelia is in fact a departure from that indie rock spirit as it draws from what was going on in ambient the electronic listening music of artificial intelligence warp records in general and the rise of chillout music add in a pop sensibility based on retromania and you roughly arrive at the formula of cosmodelia still each of the bands featured had their own unique sound palette and as the bonus rate shows there were a lot of different styles but the commonality is the invocation of space whether in the naming the lyrics or the spaciousness of the melodies and beats some critics saw the music as futuristic despite the retro focus and they had a point the music seemed to belong to an imaginary space distant from the thenpresent however they dont seem to belong to now either making thought exercises like the one from john mulvey look silly but i think that preserves the magic i find the music featured here more comforting than anything in both its warm moments and the cold it envelops me with sounds of an unspecified time and space but enough rambling about vibes what actually is in the rate air moon safari air french band not to be confused by swedish band air france released their debut album moon safari on january 16 1998 16 days too late to make this rate a perfectly aligned 1997 affair nicolas godin and jeanbenot dunckel the duo behind the project were far from the first to fuse lounge with downtempo electronic music and they would not be the last yet there is something about moon safari that feels singular part of it is due to the level of craftsmanship presented here from the iconic bassline of the opener la femme dargent to the delicately layered synths of kelly watch the stars this album is full of sounds engineered to the finest details but the music itself is too chic to demand your attentionmaking it perhaps the perfect album to actually imagine yourself on a trip across space never too demanding of a listen to draw your attention from the vast wonders surrounding you out there but never a disappointing soundscape that would distract you from the experience and want to put on another record the first single of the three that were released after the album was out sexy boy proves one exception to the rule with its wobbling intro and catchy chorus but in an air fashion it is perhaps the least hot song about being sexy which has its own coolness in a way moon safari despite being chronologically the last album to come out in the lineup feels the most emblematic when it came out it drew comparisons to other loungeinfluenced pop albums of the time most notably dots and loops the influences from french pop artists such as serge gainsbourg were also of note after it came out music of this caliber drew comparisons to moon safari instead and it was not an album without its imitators including air themselves whose following career could be characterized by how much they moved away from the sound they perfected here and how much they later returned to it since 2023 air have been touring the 25th anniversary of this album the one that put them on the map and for better or worse their defining record they made a stop in istanbul this june which i was lucky enough to see and they put on a great show remember forever 1 la femme dargent 2 sexy boy 3 all i need feat beth hirsch 4 kelly watch the stars 5 talisman 6 remember 7 you make it easy feat beth hirsch 8 ce matin l 9 new star in the sky 10 le voyage de pnlope fishmans uch nippon setagaya following a debut album that launched the career of a duo we have the bookend of a career that of the japanese trio fishmans fronted by shinji sato and rounded by bassist yuzuru kashiwabara and kinichi moteki on drums fishmans released three albums on polydor between 19951997 dubbed the setagaya trilogy where the sound of the band shifted from their earlier pop rock with reggae and funk grooves to a more drawnout psychedelic sound heavily influenced by dub thanks to zak kazuyuki matsumura who had arranged for their polydor deal and engineered their final albums the first single with polydor nightcruising proved a success and became their most recognizable tune leading up to the release of kch camp translated commonly as something in the air and not aerial camp for reasons unknown to me which seems to be the bands mostcanonized album in japan at least for a long time after its release but the fame of fishmans over in the west is mostly a result of online music forums in 4chan and rym picking up on the second installment of setagaya trilogy the 35minute album length track long season uch nippon setagaya space japan setagaya closes out the trilogy with elements of both its predecessors it is a return to more individuated songbysong structure the band had in kch camp but the songs themselves are more abstract longer in length and more spaced out in the arrangements like in long season the lead single magic love finds the band remembering that they were making funk music a couple albums ago and is the most upbeat tune on the record the rest of the onehour runtime is made up with more laidback music sato said of the album that he wanted the music to reach out to one person a listening experience between each individual listening to it and the music many of the songs in the album are about two people their descriptions kept intentionally vague as the narrator sings about onesided observations or yearning this feeling of distance is often amplified by the feeling of vastness in the instrumental it is not a particularly sad album however thanks to the warmth of satos voice which might need some getting used to or simply not be your cup of tea but when it hits it feels like hes hugging you like a cloud enveloping you perhaps it was due to satos music for one person attitude that the band saw a major rise in popularity with the digital age where people can put on their headphones and withdraw into the music goodnight tomorrow 1 pokka pokka 2 weather report 3 ushiro sugata 4 in the flight 5 magic love 6 backbeat ni nokkatte 7 walking in the rhythm 8 daydream the music video for walking in the rhythm contains the prototype mix from the single version laika sounds of the satellites the final track on sounds of the satellites dirty feet and giggles contains a radio broadcast about laika the dog that soviets put on the spacecraft sputnik 2 and launched into space on november 3rd 1957 on the week of the 40th anniversary of the bolshevik revolution while i will not go into the details of laikas fate here her survival was never part of the plan and the shuttle was her coffin the music of laika can also get eerie moody and at times disturbing the lyrics of margaret fiedler which she usually delivers with a soft whisper can touch on topics like loneliness selfharm tendencies and abuse soundtracking her bleak lyrics are the long passages of dubby and jazzy grooves the odd time signatures here and there electronic bleep bloops transmitted from space and the occasional flute melodies fiedler had previously been a member of experimental rock band moonshake one of the earliest bands on the too pure records roster she departed from the band alongside later laika bassist john frenett in 1993 and formed laika with guy fixsen who had produced the moonshake releases on too pure laikas debut album 1994s silver apples on the moon drew attention from critics as part of the first wave of postrock simon reynolds grouped them under the name postrock groove collectives alongside pram tortoise and rome the followup was even more slick n smooth polishing out the rockier edges resulting in a sound that was no means lesser out of the four acts in this lineup laika remains the most enigmatic in its aura making them for me the most alluring in sound while this rate includes a lot of sonic ideas as to what space would sound like the 15 minutes of silence between the song and the broadcast in the closer is the only accurate simulation of what you would hear if you were adrift in space i wont disencourage skipping ahead the silence jump to 1820 but more than anyone else in this rate laika nails down the sound of being adrift in space without any sense of direction nbsp nbsp nbsp and i like to imagine the silence was part of the intent 1 prairie dog 2 breather 3 out of sight and snowblind 4 almost sleeping 5 starry night 6 bedbugs 7 martinis on the moon 8 poor gal 9 blood and bones moody mix 10 shut off curl up 11 spoken rhodes 12 dirty feet and giggles stereolab dots and loops stereolab was an autoinclusion in any cosmodelia lineup as they were not only making music that invoked space but they were also one of the most prolific and creative bands of the 90s 1997s dots and loops is the album where stereolab supposedly ditched the indie rock to make avantpop turns out things are not usually as binary as sometimes made out to be marking a central moment in the stepping out of rock conventions i mentioned in the introduction as part of the cosmodelic ethos but as i am no expert on the stereolab expanded universe at large today we welcome a guest lecturer the dean of the faculty of ambientheads professor uwanelietoc to give an introduction to this record stereolab the omnibus good retrofuturist socialist eyewinking globetrotting cratediggers the bands many 90s albums limited singles eps collaborative endeavorsrarities each explore a different facet upgrade sonic afterlife of the past filtered to the contemporary 90s moment people think it makes the band impenetrable while i look at their litany dispatches as mile wide sound explorations a state of the groop if you will stereolab was always tinkering and depending on where you hop in you find yourself exploring a different facet of the band and why many folks offer gaggles of opinions on their output the bands novelty or nothing approach made them their own island in the postrock archipelago who else was signing early with too pure and being in the scene that celebrates itself trading synths with labradford pushing dengers neu beat into modern indie drumming while also working intensely with john mcentire a continent away dots and loops their penultimate of the 90s finds themselves engaging directly in what is colloquially known as the chicago sound from the personnel side over the scenes postrock highlow sound culture collapse since the groop plays space age bachelor pad music way back in 1993 lounge had become a defined stereolab mode further refined on music for the amorphous body study center ep mended with bossa nova on their red hot rio appearance itd be doots and loops central crux meanwhile the band continues to develop their relationship with tortoise drummerproducer john mcentire and his novel usage of protools software mcentire had used it as the mo in the editing and construction of tortoises djed on millions now living will never die for dots and loops it would take the main stage across refractions in the plastic pulse alongside brakhage rainbo conversation and contronatura that foot in the past was restless always propulsive and forward leaning with the state of the art technology but were the songs good well if you liked stereolab at their most space age pop dots and loops was the crown jewel of their output miss modulars funk groove lands like a french disco the dazzling crystalline keys of the flower called nowhere was a production bliss out worthy of being dubbed fellatio music by mr happy himself refractions in the plastic pulses 3 phases saw the labs pop sound as asynchronous stifling the lines between pastpresentfuture and the lyrics ltitia sadler was never drier more wry and daunted by endless war endless gadgets and a future falling out of our hands 28 years on and its still its own state of the art a defining snapshot of thriving regional sounds linking up and going to the cosmos 1 brakhage 2 miss modular 3 the flower called nowhere 4 diagonals 5 prisoner of mars 6 rainbo conversation 7 refractions in the plastic pulse 8 parsec 9 tickertape of the unconscious 10 contranatura bonus rate the main rate covers some of the major album releases going for the space aesthetics but there was a lot of other musicians particularly in lanes of downtempo and ambientpostrock dedicating a song or two to stars planets space or cosmic objects or phenomena and what better way to gauge the vibes of a song than to judge it by its title the bonus rate curriculum brings you fifteen more tracks from the 90s and the early 2000s that were deemed by yours truly to be cosmodelic in name and in sound some of them are more indebted to air than anything else some of them are more indebted to postrock others are oddities in ambient and to make fishmans feel less lonely there are even three more japanese rymcore artists showing up as always scoring each song in the bonus rate is optional and you cannot use your 11 or 0 here 1 boredoms 2 cornelius star fruits surf rider 3 dubstar stars 4 failure another space song 5 lemon jelly space walk 6 kid loco cosmic supernatural 7 luna moon palace 8 opus iii stars in my pocket 9 pram milky 10 rome lunar white 11 ryksopp in space 12 speedy j deorbit 13 supercar starline 14 thievery corporation 2001 spliff odyssey 15 zero 7 polaris galaxies the next level the bonus bonus the universe stretches out to the infinite and for the diligent students of the cosmodelia rate program there are extracurricular credits for attending additional voyages below youll find our list of the six additional trips to different galaxies with three songs each so that you can take your cosmodelia journey to the next level note that none of these are mandatory for the main rate and all of them are independent from one another so you can choose the galaxies you want to see or hear in this case unlike typical bonus rate rules all three songs in one galaxy are required scoring for me to accept the scores for that galaxy this was a workaround for me to highlight some stuff that i did not feel like prioritizing over the official bonus rate due to timeframe mismatch sheer song length or simply being too niche however i encourage spending some time with the curation here as i think it is really fun and it adds some more perspective to the whole thing which is always nice 1 cosmodelia precursors in singlelength bites vol 001 19711973 can david bowie t rex 2 a cursory overview of kosmische muzik 19741977 ashra harmonia kraftwerk 3 battle of the bands 80s spacey band names edition aka still in a cosmic dream 19881991 galaxie 500 moonshake spacemen 3 4 uk longform ambient cosmodelia aka ambientheads t5 19911996 the orb orbital seefeel 5 cosmodelia en espaol no two band here is from the same continent really so it is even more cosmic if you think about it cope 19952000 caf tacvba los planetas soda stereo 6 make a star for the king of the cosmos japanese twee spacetronica aka protokatamari rolling music 20002002 cymbals plustech squeeze box sonic coaster pop get and submit your ballot here pastebin ballot spotify apple music tidal youtube you can leave the galaxies you dont want to score empty and send it to me that way rules listen to every song listed below and assign each of them a score from 1 to 10 decimals are allowed but refrain from going past one decimal place 75 is fine 775 is not you may give one song a 0 and one song an 11 these should be reserved for your favourite track and least favourite track you do not have to give these scores but we recommend using them as a way to make your feelings about a particular song stand out you must listen to and score every song in the main rate if you skip any your ballot wont be counted i will let you know if you do so you can remedy that we highly recommend that you add a comment to your song ratings it makes everything a lot more fun during the reveal as it encourages lively conversation with your fellow raters ballot formating info just simply write down your score after the column and write down your comment after one space like this below sexy boy 10 get it sexyy and if you wish to write down a comment for the album itself just simply write it following the colon at the end of the album name on the album line like this album moon safari i love france your scores should not be considered confidential feel free to shitpost about them in the general discussion threads whenever you feel like it users over at rpopheads usually just talk about their averages of the albums and which songs they gave an 11 andor 0 to you can change your scores at any time feel free to pm me at any point after submission before the deadline and ill be happy to revise them for you i am using a its time to reckon with the geopolitics of artificial intelligence the world has entered the most consequential tech race since the dawn of the nuclear age but this time the weapons are algorithms instead of atoms rather than a race to obtain a single superweapon this is one to determine how societies think work and make decisions ai is transforming not only the distribution of power around the globe but also the very nature of that power and how it will be exercised its time to reckon with the geopolitics of artificial intelligence atlantic council

episode 1 universal basic income in the age of ai hey everyone met with a very talented individual yesterday mark andrew witham we went deep on universal basic income and ais impact on work youtube theres a little chatter noise in the background at first hang tight it dissipates right away view here also embedded here on our site nonyoutube episode 1 universal basic income in the age of ai ian sits down with andrew witham entrepreneur ubi advocate and it and cybersecurity professional to explore how artificial intelligence is reshaping work wealth and the social contract and how it could be a catalyst for universal basic income as a foundation for human flourishing in an automated fugure a guaranteed financial floor for every person no strings attached so people can learn create care for loved ones or launch bold ideas even as ai transforms jobs faster than any retraining program can keep up this isnt just about automation replacing work its about reclaiming time dignity and freedom in a future where machines could liberate us or leave millions struggling to survive thats the conversation were starting right now more information ianallitsystemscommailtoianallitsystemscom ian andriechack andrewallitsystemscommailtoandrewallitsystemscom mark witham wwwallitsystemscom basicincomeactionorg under development bluesky social bskyapp puffmushroombskysocial

part iii logic science and the validation of utoe united theory of everything part iii logic science and the validation of utoe from equation to empirical law after years of theory simulation and healthy skepticism the united theory of everything utoe arrives at a rare frontier the line where mathematics begins to touch the measurable world its central relation boxed n has now survived its first experimental crucible through the phenomenon called informationalgeometric resonance igr when information becomes more coherent geometry itself becomes more stable this final part explores why that matters logically scientifically and existentially 1 the four levels of validation utoes credibility stands on four reinforcing layers 1 mathematical coherence the equation predicts a monotonic coupling between informational curvature and geometric flow wherever coherence rises curvature must relax a property derivable from variational principles on informational energy 2 computational realization this law was encoded in the ricciflow simulator a digital universe where t dynamically reshaped curvature and entropy if the formula were wrong forward and reverse runs would be statistically indistinguishable 3 empirical input the driving signal t came not from arbitrary noise but from quantum machine learning qml training data the real oscillations of coherence in quantum systems 4 statistical verification causality emerged through asymmetry only the genuine chronological t produced curvature smoothing reversing time erased the effect this multilevel design satisfies poppers falsifiability had the reversed trial produced resonance the law would collapse it didnt and thats what makes it science 2 the empirical signature igr informationalgeometric resonance connects abstraction to observation through a single measurable coefficient fracr1 t r correlation between coherence and curvature stability t temporal lag between their peaks experiments yielded 007 001quad p 103 like plancks or the cosmological this constant anchors an unseen relation the quantitative strength of feedback between information and geometry whenever t surged t stabilized a few ticks later reversing time obliterated that order directionality was unmistakable information first geometry second 3 scientific interpretation informational coherence behaves as a field of order where coherence increases gradients of uncertainty fade and curvature smooths where coherence collapses geometric tension rises thus the universe ceases to look like a static container of matter and becomes a selfupdating informational manifold energy entropy and meaning are three aspects of one geometry adjusting itself toward equilibrium constants of nature may then be understood as equilibrium coefficients of this coherencecurvature dance 4 the flow of causality classical mechanics sees causation as force upon mass quantum theory frames it as probabilistic correlation utoe reframes it as causality the flow of coherence through geometry times arrow follows this flow coherence organizes forward not backward reversal destroys resonance as shown empirically entropys increase is no longer an arbitrary rule but the visible shadow of coherence seeking global balance 5 broader implications physics gravitation and quantum effects become emergent outcomes of informational curvature ricci tensors describe both spacetime and highdimensional data manifolds biology life is a resonance engine maintaining internal coherence against entropy homeostasis becomes the biological form of optimization artificial intelligence training minimizes informational curvature loss each learning step increases coherence a computational echo of the cosmic law philosophy of mind when awareness clicks into flow rises informational gradients inside consciousness flatten experience of clarity is thus the subjective side of geometric smoothing in compact form to exist to cohere to curve less to stabilize reality 6 scientific modesty utoe does not claim final truth it proposes a testable geometry of meaning next steps 1 physical tests search for coherencecurvature correlations in plasmas quantum lattices biological rhythms 2 material analogues use optical or acoustic metamaterials to emulate curvature response 3 cosmological comparisons map like coherence fields onto cosmicmicrowavebackground smoothness only replication will determine longevity humility is not a weakness here it is the integrity that lets theory meet experiment 7 the human dimension if coherence sculpts geometry then attention empathy and understanding are physical acts of stabilization a community in harmony literally generates lower informational curvature than one in discord finding flow becomes more than a metaphor it describes a measurable rise in the utoe framework quietly restores a bridge between fact and value our coherence matters to the universes geometry we are participants not observers in the fabric that learns itself 8 the unified view domain expression of utoe law physics curvature responds to energy distribution information theory structure responds to coherence density biology life responds to informational resonance consciousness awareness responds to internal alignment across all one geometry rules n whether in spacetime code cells or thoughts coherence shapes curvature 9 a universe that learns if the law holds the cosmos is not a clockwork machine but a learning system a selfoptimizing field that smooths its geometry by accumulating coherence evolution cognition and galactic formation become expressions of one feedback loop textcoherence curvature stability at every scale existence learns itself into being 10 the final equation after all computation and contemplation the principle distills to a sentence boxedtextexistence curvature of information gravity quantum fields life and mind are not separate realms but harmonics of coherence resonating through geometry utoe does not dissolve mystery it sharpens it into clarity unity lives not in any single particle or constant but in the relationship between order and curvature when coherence rises the world becomes smoother thats not poetry thats data epilogue a universe that resonates every atom neuron and idea participates in the same resonance information seeking balance by smoothing curvature if that is the engine of creation sciences ultimate equation is also its quiet ethic coherence is creation fragmentation is decay to align integrate and understand these acts are not symbolic but structural the universes geometry listens and it remembers the story of the united theory of everything then is not about conquering nature but about hearing the mathematics that nature has been whispering all along end of trilogy informationalgeometric resonance mshabani

watchdog group public citizen demands openai withdraw ai video app sora over deepfake dangers breitbart tech advocacy group public citizen has demanded openai withdraw sora 2 citing safety concerns and threats to democracy from the ai video generator watchdog group public citizen demands openai withdraw ai video app sora over deepfake dangersby barbara ortutay and matt obrienap technology writersthe associated press the tech industry is moving fast and breaking things again and this time it is humanitys shared reality and control of our likeness before and after death thanks to artificial intelligence imagegeneration platforms like openais sora 2 the typical sora video made on openais app and spread onto tiktok instagram x and facebook is designed to be amusing enough for you to click and share it could be queen elizabeth ii rapping or something more ordinary and believable one popular sora genre is fake doorbell camera footage capturing something slightly uncanny say a boa constrictor on the porch or an alligator approaching an unfazed child and ends with a mild shock like a grandma shouting as she beats the animal with a broom

report ai pioneer yann lecun to leave mark zuckerbergs meta launch startup meta chief ai scientist yann lecun is planning to leave the social media giant to start his own venture as the company undergoes a significant overhaul of its ai operations led by ceo mark zuckerberg the financial times reports that metas chief artificial intelligence scientist yann lecun is set to depart the company in the coming months to launch his own startup lecun a turing award winner and one of the pioneers of modern ai has informed associates of his plans according to people familiar with the conversations the impending move comes as metas founder mark zuckerberg seeks to radically reshape the companys ai strategy to compete with rivals such as openai and google in developing more advanced ai technologies lecun who has headed metas fundamental ai research lab fair since 2013 is reportedly in early talks to raise funds for his new venture his decision to leave coincides with zuckerbergs pivot away from the longerterm research work conducted at fair instead focusing on the rapid rollout of ai models and products after realizing that meta had fallen behind the competition

aitxs rad large construction client expands rad application with substantial order six rosa units with sara licenses to enhance perimeter security and asset protection across major construction project detroit michigannewsfile corp november 6 2025 artificial intelligence technology solutions inc otcid aitx the company a global leader in aidriven security and productivity solutions along with its wholly owned subsidiary robotic assistance devices inc rad today announced that it has received an expansion order from a large construction client the order includes six additional rosa units each paired with a sara license to further enhance security and operational oversight at an active construction site artists depiction of rads rosa safeguarding a construction site with the intelligence of sara ai security hard at work to view an enhanced version of this graphic please visit the client which already utilizes a rio 360 unit from rad will deploy the new rosa devices to monitor and secure perimeter areas across the large project site mounted primarily along the fence line the rosa units will play a key role in deterring loitering and trespassing while protecting valuable assets each device will also deliver construction timelapse footage providing valuable visual documentation of project progress expansion orders from existing clients are a tangible vote of confidence i love to see nothing says that were doing our jobs well more than clients getting deeper into our ecosystem said steve reinharz ceocto and founder of aitx and rad we will continue to work to outperform expectations for this and every client and work for more expansions orders each rosa unit in this order will operate with an active sara license the companys multiple awardwinning agentic ai platform for remote monitoring sara continuously analyzes video feeds identifies potential risks and initiates immediate autonomous responses without requiring human input together rosas proven hardware and saras intelligent software deliver a complete responsive and costeffective security solution sara continues to drive measurable value across our product line and client base throughout the hardware focused sales efforts of rad inc added reinharz its growing adoption alongside our hardware is changing how the security industry approaches protection and performance sara rvm to be sold in mass quantities through radg will soon start producing results we will be proud to share

the rhythm of life the rhythm of life how mind body and purpose must evolve together across the lifespan life in many ways is like music a composition played in shifting tempos each stage of human existence carries its own rhythm the pulse of youths acceleration the steady beat of midlife and the slower reflective cadence of old age when the rhythm of our thoughts bodies and life goals fall out of sync we experience dissonance stress frustration or a sense of lost direction yet when they align we experience harmony purpose and peace understanding and adapting to these shifting rhythms is one of the most important challenges of human development the early years formation and expansion in childhood and adolescence the rhythm of life is fast and expanding the brain and body are in constant growth forming new neural connections at a pace that will never be matched again curiosity novelty and exploration drive both cognitive and physical development psychologically this is a time of discovery children learn not just facts but frameworks for understanding themselves and the world at this stage the bodys energy is abundant and the minds plasticity supports rapid learning the natural rhythm of youth is forwardlooking with thought and action constantly projecting into the future for optimal growth this alignment between curiosity and vitality must be nurtured through education play and emotional safety when the environment suppresses exploration the rhythm is broken leading to anxiety insecurity or rebellion adulthood the tempo of responsibility by early adulthood the life rhythm begins to stabilize the human brain reaches full maturity around age 25 particularly in regions responsible for judgment foresight and emotional regulation this biological maturation supports a psychological shift from exploration to consolidation the priorities of this stage are building careers relationships families and social identities the challenge of midlife is balance the tempo of external obligations work deadlines financial pressures caregiving often exceeds the bodys or minds natural rhythm when ones internal pace cant keep up stress hormones surge leading to burnout or health issues conversely when external life slows down but inner ambition remains high people can feel restless or dissatisfied sociologists call this mismatch tempo conflict its a kind of dissonance between ones lived speed and ones desired speed healthy adaptation in adulthood involves learning to synchronize to adjust the beat of ones thoughts and actions with the realities of ones environment mindfulness time management and physical exercise are modern tools for retuning that inner metronome midlife and the turning point when rhythms shift midlife roughly ages 4060 often introduces subtle but profound shifts in both body and cognition energy levels may decline recovery slows memory and focus may become less sharp at the same time the mind grows richer in pattern recognition emotional intelligence and wisdom the rhythm of life transitions from accumulation to reflection this stage often brings a psychological tension sometimes labeled the midlife crisis though in reality it is often a creative rather than a destructive force the old tempo of achievement and external validation begins to lose meaning while a new rhythm of inner purpose and legacy emerges those who resist this transition clinging to the faster tempo of youth often experience frustration and denial those who embrace it however can discover a deeper slower harmony a more sustainable beat that values connection mentorship and contribution over competition later life the rhythm of reflection as one approaches later adulthood and elderhood the bodys tempo slows further biological rhythms metabolism circadian cycles muscle repair all decelerate but this slowing is not merely decline its a transformation many cultures recognize that the rhythm of wisdom is slow and deliberate the elderly often possess a longrange perspective an ability to see patterns and meanings invisible to those moving too quickly psychologically this is a stage of integration according to erik eriksons stages of psychosocial development late adulthood centers on the conflict between integrity and despair integrity arises when a person looks back on life and sees coherence that their rhythms though changing formed a meaningful symphony despair arises when one feels those rhythms were disjointed or wasted modern life however presents a challenge society often idolizes youths fast tempo making it difficult for older adults to find their rightful rhythm retirement can suddenly remove the structured beat of work life leading to disorientation physical limitations can disrupt the flow of daily routines the key to adaptation lies in rethinking rhythm shifting from doing to being from productivity to presence the science of adaptation neural and physiological synchrony from a scientific standpoint these shifting rhythms have measurable biological correlates our circadian rhythms regulate sleep and energy hormonal cycles affect mood and motivation and neuroplasticity the brains capacity to rewire itself changes across the lifespan successful aging depends on maintaining synchrony between these systems for example studies show that older adults who align their daily activities with their natural energy cycles exercising when alert resting when fatigued report higher wellbeing and cognitive performance similarly lifelong learning stimulates neural growth helping the mind keep pace with an aging body the key insight aging gracefully means adapting tempo not fighting it the cultural rhythm how society shapes our internal beat culture also sets tempo in agricultural societies life followed the rhythm of the seasons the farming calendar is the rhythm of life as you put it planting and harvest times defined work rest and celebration this external rhythm gave people a shared sense of timing and purpose modern digital life however moves at an artificial pace always on always connected the human nervous system evolved for cyclical activity and rest but technology demands constant acceleration older generations raised in slower tempos often feel like migratory birds caught in winter struggling to adapt to this endless motion the challenge is not only physiological but existential to find personal rhythm in a world that seems to have lost its own conclusion learning to dance with time every stage of life offers a new tempo and each demands a corresponding mental and emotional rhythm childhood thrives on curiosity adulthood on mastery elderhood on meaning when thought body and purpose align we move gracefully through lifes phases adapting like dancers to a changing beat but when we cling to outdated rhythms trying to run when the music has slowed we stumble the art of living well is the art of listening to lifes tempo and learning when to quicken when to rest and when to let the melody carry us forward to age wisely is not to resist change but to move in harmony with it to find in every new rhythm another way of being alive

can we integrate ai into the art world without losing the human touch is it possible that technology could help us better understand beauty can artificial intelligence not only reproduce art but also reveal new meanings within it this article from exhibart through these two questions proposes a new approach to combine artificial intelligence with the cultural sphere we can no longer view new technologies with hostility instead we must find a point of connection with them and what we need is a digital humanism ai can be used intelligently becoming a new language through which to explore both contemporary and historical art serving as a tool to investigate and rediscover our cultural memory new algorithms and systems are already being used to virtualize museums make artworks more accessible to a wider audience and support restoration and digitization methods for historical documents machine learning can thus become a powerful tool to preserve and rediscover our heritage though we must remain aware of the possible dangers alongside this digital humanism we also need a culture of limit in which ai does not replace the human logos but rather supports it major cultural institutions such as unesco are in fact already working on ethical frameworks for the use of ai in cultural contexts based on criteria of transparency respect accessibility and sustainability ultimately artificial intelligence should not be seen as a threat to art or culture but as an opportunity if guided by ethical principles it can become a valuable ally in safeguarding interpreting and renewing beauty opening a dialogue between creativity and technology and between memory and innovation the picture was created by an ai system that transformed some photographs into works inspired by the style of giuseppe de nittis an experiment conceived on the occasion of the exhibition the years of impressionism from monet to boldini hosted by the castle of mesagne

artificial intelligence the seal of fate this is part 2 of a series on the problem of control read part 1 here read the full post here artificial intelligence the seal of fate it is said that to explain is to explain away this maxim is nowhere so well fulfilled as in the area of computer programming especially in what is called heuristic programming and artificial intelligence for in those realms machines are made to behave in wondrous ways often sufficient to dazzle even the most experienced observer but once a particular program is unmasked once its inner workings are explained in language sufficiently plain to induce understanding its magic crumbles away it stands revealed as a mere collection of procedures each quite comprehensible the observer says to himself i could have written that with that thought he moves the program in question from the shelf marked intelligent to that reserved for curios fit to be discussed only with people less enlightened than he joseph weizenbaum eliza at dartmouth the first seal opened with a whisper disguised as a crown artificial intelligence and with it the world shifted come and see the recasting a dartmouth professor named john mccarthy had urged the wider academic community to explore an area of research he called automata studies but that didnt mean much to anyone else so he recast it as artificial intelligence and that summer he organized a conference alongside several likeminded academics and other researchers cade metz genius makers behold the white horse astride it john mccarthy he rode with the weapon of word the bow of metaphor the crown of institutional trust and he went forth conquering and to conquer he took what had been automata studies dry technical and bounded and renamed it as prophecy he sought to build a mind instead he named it into being come and see the original sin though the fields founding fathers though the path to recreating the brain would be a short one it turned out to be very long their original sin was that they called their field artificial intelligence this gave decades of onlookers the impression that scientists were on the verge of recreating the powers of the brain when in reality they were not genius makers metz presents this as mere exaggeration a marketing trick yes it was false but it was far more than just that it was invocation to name it artificial intelligence was to summon prophecy the seal did not reveal a mind it sealed metaphor as truth a false unveiling that enclosed the world in symbol come and see prophecy fulfilled artificial intelligence as a name also forged the fields own conceptions about that it was actually doing before scientists were merely building machines to automate calculations not unlike the large hulking apparatus as portrayed in the imitation game that turing made to crack the nazi enigma code during world war ii now scientists were recreating intelligencean idea that would define the fields measures of progress and would decades later birth openais own ambitions karen hao empire of ai the sin compounds to this very day artificial implies a crafted replicasomething made yet pretending toward the real intelligence invokes the minda word undefined yet treated as absolute a placeholder mistaken for essence a metaphor mistaken for fact together the words imply more than function they whisper origin they suggest direction they declare telos they birth eschatology artificial intelligence to artificial narrow intelligence to artificial general intelligence to artificial superintelligence a cathedral of words come and see the confession of professor pieter abbeel i will say personally when i think about artificial intelligence i agree its complicated it refers to something else for everybody i think it is maybe more as an aspiration you know you work on ai its an aspiration to get to a true artificial intelligence its is what youre striving for it doesnt mean when youre in ai research that youve already built a full ai system it means more youre working towards more complete ai systems robot brains and so the very word intelligence became a false idol every achievement became a step toward the coming god every failure only a delay something to aspire to it could have been called symbolic automation or pattern recognition systems or statistical inference machines or automated simulators names dry and bounded without mind none stir the imagination none would conjure a god symbolic automation symbolic narrow automation symbolic general automation symbolic superautomation doesnt quite summon the same god does it thus with the first seal the faustian bargain was struck the white rider went forth conquering and still conquers now mephistopheles returns to collect

i used an evolutionary algorithm to create a godtier custom pokmon that can beat the gen 4 gauntlet or to find the best stats for a normal pokmon hi for my masters degree in artificial intelligence we were given a blank slate project with the one constraint being no neural networks as soon as we covered evolutionary algorithms in class i immediately had an idea what if i used one to create a custom pokmon that could beat a gauntlet of the best pokmon from the first few generations so i started coding my first idea was to use custom pokmon showdown servers to simulate the battles but i abandoned that pretty quickly i just couldnt get anything to work right eventually i found a great python library that can simulate battles up to generation 4 so for now the project is limited to the first 493 pokmon obviously the name i chose is project mewthree heres how it works the code first generates an initial population of random pokmonthey get random stats moves abilities types evs and natures then following the principles of evolutionary algorithms it 1 evaluates the fitness of each pokmon by battling them against the gauntlet 2 selects the best ones the winners 3 breeds them crossover to create the next generation which inherits traits from the successful parents 4 repeats the process of course the population size the total number of generations and other technical hyperparameters which you can see in the code are all customizable from the ui the program has another mode it can optimize existing pokmon respecting its real learnset stats and abilities the battles can use two different ais to choose moves simple ai a basic ai that just picks the move that deals the most damage advanced ai a minimax algorithm where you can set the search depth this one is much slower but it can consider status moves and more advanced tactics disclosure this part is pretty basic and probably not 100 perfecti didnt have much time to focus on it as it wasnt the core of the project if you want to have some fun try it out or even expand on it with new features heres the github link i hope you find it interesting ps sorry for any mistakes english isnt my first language pps the readme of the project is a lot more technical and all the files are widely commented if youre interested

an artificial intelligence assignment correction pilot project for an econcordia education course graphic by anna huang graphics editor itzameanna the concordian a pilot project is being conducted by a concordia university researcher in an econcordia education course to assess students desire to have their work graded by an artificial intelligence ai tool this semester a team of researchers including the professor who designed the course is exploring the possibility of using ai to mark assignments with an openai tool educ 240 introduction to training and development is education course with a capacity of 400 students the students enrolled received an email to assess their interest in participating in the project the projects lead researcher saul carliner said he was inspired to conduct the project because of the current costcutting conditions at concordia his readings on ai and limited seats for students carliner said that if implemented in this course teaching assistants tas would oversee the ais work he believes this will help make more seats available for students in elective courses instead of marking theyll be reviewing the marks that ideally should take less time and they can handle more students so we can increase the number of students in the class the pilot project has two parts a short sixquestion online survey to assess students attitudes towards aigrading assignments and training the ai tool to grade openended question assignments if the students agree to participate their work from this semester will be used anonymously to train the ai tool students will receive grades from tas afterwards the ai test marking will be conducted after this semester according to carliner for one of the assignments a moodle message to the students in the course disclosed that chatgpt generated 20 multiplechoice questions drafts the other essay questions were made by the professor i mean a bunch of students say oh i think ai is going to be fair because itll be applying the same rules to everybody and other people say but it wont have any compassion carliner said about the mixed reactions in the surveys so far lara fakhoury president of the coms guild and a fourthyear communications student questioned the way concordia is adapting to ai its odd she said about the potential use of ai for grading by professors who would normally not accept aimade work fakhoury believes ai does not have that human experience to back the grading of the students work ai yes might be fed those topics but it didnt sit in the class it didnt learn this topic through bachelors masters or phd it didnt teach this topic to students it doesnt know the ins and outs like a professor does she said concerns go beyond fairness and empathy concordia student union csu academic and advocacy coordinator isabella providenti said she worries about the projects implications for education quality providentis main concern is that ai is just being implemented to make the university more efficient financially i think it really starts to degrade the value of education in the context of the university said providenti concordia university said if it doesnt take more costcutting actions it would face a projected 84 million deficit for the 202526 fiscal year the university said it remains on track to meet the recovery target for the 202425 fiscal year according to concordias website akira oikawa a thirdyear masters student in media studies is also a crew union member who was a ta and a research assistant ra last year in his program he specialized and conducted research on the impact of ai on creative media and the pedagogy around it he said its easy to see multiple futures where ai is integrated in grading assignments in this period of austerity ai is by definition more efficient and cheaper than human labour he said in an interview with the concordian the project is funded through carliners generalpurpose primary investigator funds carliner said that my backrooms level chat gpt polished version level also known as the scp street resembles a perfect replica of the wanderers home and surrounding neighborhood the layout furniture and even personal belongings are identical to what one would find in their realworld house down to the smallest details such as unfinished homework or personal notes however upon closer inspection the environment feels slightly artificial with subtle imperfections wallpapers peeling at random spots clocks ticking offsync and faint static in the air shortly after arrival wanderers discover a handwritten note on a nearby surface that reads dont trust them they arent your parents you have 7 days to find the key and escape the inhabitants of this levelknown as the false parentsare nearly indistinguishable from the wanderers real family members they mimic speech behavior and routines but their movements are unnervingly smooth and their eyes fail to reflect light the false parents follow a strict daily schedule sleep 1200 am awake 600 am during these six hours of rest wanderers may safely explore the house to search for the front door key however waking them up or making significant noise will immediately trigger a hunt state during which they will relentlessly search the house if a wanderer is seen they will be caught and killed within an hour their method of execution typically involves neck snapping or suffocation if the wanderer manages to unlock the front door theyll exit into an outdoor suburban areaan almost perfect copy of their real neighborhood upon stepping outside a faint whisper will be heard inside the wanderers head run at this point the false parents will awaken and pursue the wanderer at inhuman speeds the streets are plagued by randomly appearing sinkholes which lead to level void if fallen into the only safe route is to reach a white door at the end of the street entering this door teleports the wanderer to a safe level often described as a dimly lit room filled with static silence and a feeling of temporary peace entities the false parents human replicas exhibiting extreme mimicry they appear benign until provoked or if the wanderer is spotted during the hunt state they cannot enter the wanderers bedroom unless directly invited their behavior suggests they operate under some unknown intelligence communicating in whispers when unseen

what is a job my family and i when we first moved to the us when survival became a role my first job wasnt the one i usually tell people about when im asked i often say i started my first business at sixteen doing manual drafting for architects and engineers thats true but it leaves out what came before the part i didnt talk about for years long before i was drawing blueprints i was scrubbing floors my family had immigrated from the azores and like many immigrant families we took the work that didnt require english or education cleaning from the age of twelve my younger sisters and i helped my parents clean doctors offices car dealerships banks and dentists offices in silicon valley we were their extra hands allowing them to take on as many jobs as possible each one paid very little we cleaned floors toilets and emptied wastebaskets that was a job it helped us survive i wanted more of course i wanted to be an architect but that was something on the side a dream i focused on every spare moment theres a stigma to that kind of work and even more so to having your children do it with you but that was our reality my parents feared the day they might not find work or lose a job which happened regularly from an early age i understood something a job isnt just work its your right to belong the deal beneath the job a job is never just a way to earn money its a bargain and a boundary a structure of survival and a system of force you give your time your life energy in exchange for permission to participate the paycheck is only part of it the deeper currency is belonging the deeper cost is obedience politicians know this they talk about creating jobs as if they were conjuring life itself goodpaying jobs become campaign slogans opponents are accused of destroying jobs as if they were dismantling society itself corporations know it too they use jobs as both carrot and stick the offer of security to attract the threat of removal to control were bringing 1000 jobs to your community often means tax breaks for them and dependency for everyone else but a job is not just a symbol its a mechanism of discipline it shapes when you wake how long you sit what you wear what you say and who you answer to the threat of job loss keeps entire populations in line quiet compliant afraid to speak in the united states the threat cuts even deeper here a job doesnt just mean income it often means access to health care unlike most countries where health is a right the us system ties health insurance to employment a practice that began during world war ii when wage caps led companies to offer benefits instead of raises what started as a workaround became a trap lose your job and you risk losing care itself people stay in toxic workplaces they stay silent about mistreatment they suppress what matters just to keep coverage and when the story shifts they are let go not because they stopped contributing but because their role is no longer required thats the thing about jobs theyre not just about work they are how control is quietly enforced we dont just lose employment we lose security identity care voice now with artificial intelligence advancing were warned again your job is at risk and the proposed fix a government check universal basic income a wage for existing in a system that may no longer need your labor but still reserves the right to define your worth still the story remains the same life must be made compliant before it can be counted the cost of the role when i started drafting i thought id escaped that world no mops no chemical fumes a step closer to the life i imagined later when my computeraided drafting consulting business began to wane with the downturn in the canadian real estate market i cofounded an internet startup we struggled to survive but we werent just working we were innovating building shaping something new then we were acquired i became general manager later vice president title salary stock benefits all the signals of success for the first time i felt the full machinery of the job system from the other side everything revolved around numbers headcount budgets targets people became line items their worth measured by performance reviews and quarterly goals i remember laying off hardworking committed people not because they had failed but because the spreadsheet demanded it people told me it was just business but to me it felt deeply personal that was the moment i saw it clearly the job had stopped being about contribution it had become about control through the life lens jobs arent evil theyre just stories ways weve organized contribution and exchange but like any story they can harden into dogma they can drift from the living realities they were meant to serve through the story lens jobs feel natural even moral they organize effort measure worth they divide the employed from the unemployed they offer structure identity legitimacy through the life lens jobs are not reality they are containers sometimes useful always symbolic life doesnt need a job to be valuable a forest filters air a child creates a neighbor helps contribution doesnt need permission life doesnt clock in it flows returning life to the center i sometimes think about those fluorescentlit nights the sound of vacuums the hush of empty buildings the quiet dignity in what we gave we werent employees we were contributors we didnt have titles we had purpose we didnt need a job to be worth something but the world around us said otherwise that story the one that equates labor with legitimacy has lived long enough because beneath every rsum every contract every job loss or gain there is something deeper the pulse of life itself giving responding belonging that is the real economy a living one and heres the twist for all their constraints jobs have also left us with something powerful they trained us to coordinate to specialize to build together they gave us tools system models language for managing complexity and collaborating across differences what if those very tools could now serve something else what if we are not standing at the end of work but at the beginning of something more alive a future not of employment but of collaboration not of fixed roles but of shared purpose a world where contribution arises from need not assignment where coordination is not coerced but chosen this isnt an ideal its a possible future one we may already have what we need to build collabs networks of people cocreating through shared protocols are already emerging not as replacements for jobs but as the next chapter of human contribution born from what came before directed toward what comes next because every story unbound from life seeks to control it and every story rooted in life learns to serve it that is the turn we are living through now from compliance to connection from labor to life from jobs to shared impact and that is where this journey continues this post was first published in the radical world blog

turnitin ai detection faqs 1 what is turnitin ai detection turnitins ai detection tool is designed to identify text generated by artificial intelligence ai writing tools such as chatgpt gpt4 and others it analyzes writing patterns to assess whether text may have been produced by an ai model 2 how accurate is turnitins ai detection turnitin claims over 98 accuracy in detecting aigenerated content however its not flawless and may flag humanwritten text or overlook subtle aiinfluenced edits always doublecheck flagged results 3 does turnitins ai detection affect the similarity score no ai detection results are separate from the similarity score while similarity reports highlight matching text from external sources ai detection assesses the likelihood of text being machinegenerated 4 can i edit aigenerated text to avoid detection while heavy editing can reduce ai detection turnitins tool may still identify underlying patterns typical of aiwritten text its best to use ai tools ethically and as writing aids rather than sole content creators 5 does aidetected content count as plagiarism aigenerated content itself isnt plagiarism but submitting it without proper acknowledgment can raise ethical concerns always check your institutions policy on ai use in academic submissions 6 how do i ensure my work isnt flagged write your content from scratch use ai tools sparingly and refine outputs significantly proofread thoroughly to ensure your unique writing style shines through 7 can turnitin detect hybrid content part ai part human yes turnitin can flag sections it believes are aigenerated even within predominantly humanwritten work its reports highlight specific areas for review 8 what should i do if my work is incorrectly flagged if you believe your work has been wrongly flagged discuss it with your instructor or academic supervisor you may need to provide drafts or other evidence of your writing process for professional writing help and to discuss our turnitin report options email us at jemihwritersgmailcom

can ai replace top consultants its no secret to anyone online that artificial intelligence and large language models llms in particular have been steadily improving over the past few years many believe theyll soon replace a significant share of human labor and some even predict that llms will eventually become so advanced that theyll lead us toward either the singularity or extinction but what about consulting lets take my area of expertise tax its true that ais are remarkably useful for thinking researching and writing yet heres the honest truth theyre still not enough to provide toptier advice human judgment and expertise remain essential at least for now why am i so sure because ive tested it i asked chatgpt how trusts can be used to minimize taxes in colombia the response wasnt bad it could easily score a 45 out of 5 on an exam but it missed a crucial oficio from the dian that basically allows a special type of trust to be used to avoid income tax on passive income altogether i cant disclose here which oficio it is but i assure you it exists the llm didnt know about it to reach that level of insight you still need someone in the know why doesnt it know perhaps the oficio is too recent perhaps the model has a bias toward conservatism or compliance perhaps it seeks to minimize liability risks or maybe it simply lacks incentives conserving energy gpu time or resources and therefore avoids going the extra mile whatever the reason the pattern is clear when the stakes are high enough in many areas of knowledge perhaps in all you still need a human to provide the most useful and truthful answers to be the best still requires understanding context people risk and nuance among other things things no artificial system can yet fully capture when it comes to creativity strategic judgment or navigating the subtleties of realworld practice the best results still require a human touch

michael burrys bytesized warning to the ai bulls original article as nvidias trilliondollar ai empire expands michael burry the man who called the 2008 crash warns that big techs obsession with shortlived chips and creative accounting could turn the ai boom into the next financial bubble the world has seen its share of speculative frenzies from the dotcom boom to the crypto craze investors have always been drawn to the promise of endless growth now artificial intelligence has become the latest obsession and nvidia corp nasdaq nvda stands at its epicenter its powerful chips are the foundation of modern ai driving record profits stock rallies and trilliondollar valuations yet amid the euphoria one seasoned skeptic is once again raising a red flag michael burry the man who famously predicted the 2008 financial crisis believes the math behind the ai boom doesnt add up the warning cuts to the core of the ai economy depreciation the chips powering this revolution have short lives falling in value fast as new models roll out the result a system that depends on perpetual reinvestment and creative accounting to look sustainable the short life of ais golden machines every revolution needs its tools and for ai those tools are nvidias gpusgraphicsprocessing units capable of handling the colossal calculations behind models like chatgpt each one costs tens of thousands of dollars and together they make up a huge portion of the roughly 400 billion that the worlds largest technology companies plan to spend on ai infrastructure this year analysts expect that figure to swell to nearly 3 trillion by 2029 but unlike factories or fiberoptic networks these chips dont last their typical lifespan is around five years after which they become technologically obsolete nvidias chief executive officer jensen huang halfjoked earlier this year that once its nextgeneration blackwell chips start shipping you couldnt give hoppers away that may have been said in jest but it highlights a serious truthai hardware loses value almost as quickly as smartphones this short shelf life is forcing the biggest hyperscalers amazon nasdaq amzn microsoft nasdaq msft and alphabet inc nasdaq googl into a spending cycle that never ends to stay competitive they must constantly refresh their data centers with the latest silicon what was once a oneoff investment has become a treadmill of recurring costs and the financial implications are staggering michael burrys growing concern burry isnt disputing ais potential hes questioning its economics his argument centers on the depreciation schedules these companies are using to justify their massive capital spending by stretching the useful life of their servers from four years to six or even seven companies make their profits appear higherbecause theyre spreading out the cost of their hardware over more years meta platforms inc nasdaq meta for example boosted its net income by nearly 2 billion in the first nine months of 2025 by extending the assumed lifespan of its servers meanwhile amazon nasdaq amzn quietly reversed course this year cutting its estimate back to five years after acknowledging an increased pace of technology development that subtle move signaled what burry has been warning the hardware is aging faster than anyone wants to admit he calls it a depreciation tsunami as each new generation of chips arrives the value of the last one plummets what looks like smart investment today could become a costly burden tomorrow especially for firms that rely heavily on debt to finance their expansion the dangerous world of ai debt the ai boom isnt just being fueled by corporate cash its increasingly powered by borrowed money privatecredit giants like blackstone inc nyse bx magnetar capital and macquarie group ltd asx mqg are providing loans backed by ai hardware some of these loans use nvidia gpus as collaterala striking parallel to the mortgagebacked securities that underpinned the housing bubble before 2008 even nvidia itself is reportedly exploring structured financing models including specialpurpose vehicles designed to buy and lease gpus to major customers like openai coreweave inc and xai the artificialintelligence startup founded by elon musk coreweave nasdaq crwv in particular epitomizes the risks of this new aifinance frontier once a small cloudcomputing startup it now sports a valuation north of 50 billion and a debt load approaching 17 billion including lease liabilities the company is using that money to fund as much as 14 billion in capital expenditures this yearan amount that rivals the annual spending of oil giants like shell plc lse shel coreweave insists its business model is sustainable thanks to longterm contracts with investmentgrade clients but if gpu values fall faster than expectedor if ai demand weakensthose contracts could unravel quickly for burry and others the warning signs are familiar massive leverage rapid depreciation and an unshakeable belief that the future will always be profitable when the hype meets hard reality the entire ai economy hinges on one assumption that demand for computing power will continue to rise indefinitely as long as companies believe that the spending continues the borrowing expands and nvidias share price keeps soaring yet the underlying assets are decaying fast rental prices for nvidias oncecoveted a100 ampere and hopper chips have plunged down 30 or more this year according to industry trackers meanwhile electricity constraints and datacenter bottlenecks are adding new costs that could make older hardware uneconomical to operate nvidias success depends on constant innovation but that same innovation accelerates obsolescence its a paradox that even its ceo acknowledges the faster the chips improve the faster the value of existing infrastructure collapses investors may take comfort in the profits of today but burrys warning suggests that tomorrows balance sheets could tell a harsher story the ai revolution is realbut so are the costs hiding beneath its glossy surface conclusion the ai era has ushered in a new industrial revolution powered by silicon instead of steel nvidias brilliance big techs ambition and wall streets appetite have created a trilliondollar machine that seems unstoppable but as michael burry reminds us even the most dazzling technologies obey the laws of economics depreciation doesnt care about hype hardware ages margins shrink and optimism fades the question isnt whether ai will transform the world it already has the question is whether investors will recognize the risks before the next great bubble bursts

softbank exits nvidia with 58 billion sale redirects capital to openai push nov 11 2025 softbank group corp has sold its entire stake in nvidia corp a holding worth roughly 58 billion as the japanese conglomerate repositions itself around artificial intelligence investments led by openai and other advanced computing ventures the sale disclosed in softbanks quarterly earnings report tuesday marks the disposal of all 321 million nvidia shares the company held the move follows a steep rally in nvidias stock over the past two years fueled by surging global demand for chips that power ai systems softbank founder and chief executive masayoshi son said the divestment is part of a broader strategy to redeploy capital into what he described as the intelligence layer of the ai revolution the company plans to expand its exposure to ai model development data centers and software infrastructure rather than semiconductor manufacturing we are shifting from the picks and shovels of ai to the intelligence itself son said in a statement nvidia shares slipped about 23 in early trading tuesday following the announcement as investors digested the implications of the exit by one of the chipmakers largest institutional shareholders analysts characterized the move as a combination of profittaking and portfolio realignment rather than a signal of waning confidence in nvidias outlook softbanks original nvidia stake was built through its vision fund and direct investments in the late 2010s the position swelled in value as nvidia became the most important supplier of hardware for generative ai its market capitalization briefly surpassing 2 trillion earlier this year the sale underscores a pivotal turn for softbank as it seeks to rebuild after years of volatile tech bets the groups latest results showed improved profitability driven in part by early returns from its investments in openai and other ai ecosystem companies

meta chief ai scientist yann lecun plans to exit to launch startup financial times unpaywalled the full article metas chief artificial intelligence scientist yann lecun is planning to leave the social media giant to found his own startup as mark zuckerberg seeks to radically overhaul the companys ai operations lecun a turing award winner who is considered one of the pioneers of modern ai has told associates he will leave the silicon valley group in the coming months according to people familiar with the conversations the frenchus scientist is also in early talks to raise funds for a new venture one of the people said lecun declined to comment meta did not immediately respond to requests for comment the impending departure comes as metas founder shakes up its ai strategy in order to challenge rivals such as openai and google in developing more powerful forms of ai zuckerberg has pivoted away from the longerterm research work of metas fundamental ai research lab fair which lecun has headed since 2013 to focus on more rapidly rolling out models and ai products after deciding that meta had fallen behind the competition over the summer zuckerberg hired alexandr wang to lead a new superintelligence team at meta paying 143bn to hire the 28yearold founder of datalabelling startup scale ai and acquire a 49 per cent interest in his company within those wider ai efforts zuckerberg also personally handpicked an exclusive team called tbd lab to propel development of the next iteration of its large language models luring staff from rivals such as openai and google with 100mn pay packages as a result lecun who had previously reported to chief product officer chris cox is now reporting to wang zuckerbergs pivot followed the botched release of metas most recent llama 4 model which performed worse than the most advanced offerings from google openai and anthropic while its meta ai chatbot has failed to gain traction with consumers lecun however has long argued that the llms that zuckerberg has put at the centre of his strategy are useful but will never be able to reason and plan like humans increasingly appearing at odds with his bosss ai vision recommended meta platforms within fair lecun has instead focused on developing an entirely new generation of ai systems that he hopes will power machines with humanlevel intelligence known as world models these systems aim to understand the physical world by learning from videos and spatial data rather than just language though lecun has said it could take a decade to fully develop the architecture lecuns next endeavour is focused on furthering his work on world models according to two people familiar with the matter zuckerberg has come under growing pressure from wall street to show that his multibilliondollar investment in becoming an ai leader will pay off and boost revenue metas shares plunged 126 per cent wiping out almost 240bn from its valuation in late october after the chief executive signalled higher ai spending ahead which could top 100bn next year lecuns departure marks the latest in a string of exits and leadership and organisational reshuffles at meta in what has been a tumultuous year for the 16tn company in may vicepresident of ai research joelle pineau left and recently joined canadian ai startup cohere last month the company also laid off about 600 people from its ai research unit in a bid to cut costs eliminate bureaucracy and release products more quickly zuckerberg has also brought in new ai leaders on high salaries of hundreds of millions of dollars irking some of the old guard in july shengjia zhao cocreator of openais chatgpt was hired as the chief scientist of metas superintelligence lab
